Milan star hints at interest in joining one club amid €38m Liverpool links
Suso claims he is happy playing in Serie A for AC Milan despite talk of him returning to Liverpool , but it appears Real Madrid could be the Spaniard’s next destination.

The Spaniard left Liverpool in January 2015 and has since become a star man at AC Milan, scoring four and assisting eight in Serie A so far this season.

Still only 24, Suso is regularly linked with a return to Anfield, but has spoken of his affection towards Milan.

“I feel important in the [Milan] team, I am very comfortable. I am happy and I get along quite well with the coach,” he stated.

“Gattuso is the same like when he played, as a coach he did not lose the intensity he used to have. When the training is over he’s the nicest and most friendly person you can find, he’s the perfect man for the team.

“Playing at home is always beautiful, now I am in a country whose culture is very similar to the Spanish one and at the moment I am very happy there.”

The dynamic changed however, when Suso responded to rumours of Real Madrid interest with pride and excitement.

“Real Madrid interest? When the best clubs in the world are interested in a player he feels proud that things are going so well. Playing for one of the biggest teams in the world can always make you happy.”
https://www.teamtalk.com/news/ac-milan-star-hints-at-interest-in-joining-one-club-amid-e38m-liverpool-links
Monaco’s scouting coordinator Geoffrey Moncada will leave the club after six years and become the head of scouts at Milan, according to Gazzetta dello Sport.

While possibly signing several midfielders over in January (Tiemoué Bakayoko, Riccardo Montolivo, José Mauri), while a long-term injury just occurred to Lucas Biglia, AC Milan management, according to Tuttosport, put Guinean international defensive midfielder Amadou Diawara (21) among the names tracked for the department. Getting quite litttle game time at Napoli, former Bologna player, currently on a deal with Azzurri until June 2021, is tracked by Tottenham as well.

FUORI BIGLIA, I ROSSONERI RISCHIANO DI PERDERE A LUNGO ANCHE BONAVENTURA: SERVONO RINFORZI
CALCIOMERCATO MILAN FABINHO / Urgono rinforzi per il Milan: Rino Gattuso continua a perdere pezzi e ora vede il suo centrocampo sempre più ridotto al lumicino.

Sono diversi i nomi seguiti dalla dirigenza rossonera, da Sensi a Diawara passando per l'opportunità Ramsey. Ma potrebbe esserci anche Fabinho nella lista dei possibili obiettivi del Milan: il centrocampista brasiliano fatica a trovare spazio nel Liverpool di Klopp e le ultime apparizioni da titolare sono frutto più di contingenze specifiche che di una scelta tecnica vera e propria. Dovesse tornare ad osservare dalla panchina le gare della sua squadra, l'ex Monaco a gennaio potrebbe anche valutare l'addio. Il suo profilo si sposerebbe alla perfezione con quello cercato dal Milan, anche se l'operazione - visto l'esborso dei 'Reds' in estate - dovrebbe essere impostata con la formula del prestito.

Milan star hints at interest in joining one club amid €38m Liverpool links
Suso claims he is happy playing in Serie A for AC Milan despite talk of him returning to Liverpool , but it appears Real Madrid could be the Spaniard’s next destination.

The Spaniard left Liverpool in January 2015 and has since become a star man at AC Milan, scoring four and assisting eight in Serie A so far this season.

Still only 24, Suso is regularly linked with a return to Anfield, but has spoken of his affection towards Milan.

“I feel important in the [Milan] team, I am very comfortable. I am happy and I get along quite well with the coach,” he stated.

“Gattuso is the same like when he played, as a coach he did not lose the intensity he used to have. When the training is over he’s the nicest and most friendly person you can find, he’s the perfect man for the team.

“Playing at home is always beautiful, now I am in a country whose culture is very similar to the Spanish one and at the moment I am very happy there.”

The dynamic changed however, when Suso responded to rumours of Real Madrid interest with pride and excitement.

“Real Madrid interest? When the best clubs in the world are interested in a player he feels proud that things are going so well. Playing for one of the biggest teams in the world can always make you happy.”

Milan are looking to loan Amadou Diawara from Napoli to replace Lucas Biglia, according to reports, but it needs the OK from Carlo Ancelotti.

The Rossoneri have lost Biglia and Giacomo Bonaventura to long-term injuries, while Riccardo Montolivo is out in the cold.

While technical director Leonardo would like to address that in January, the club is still awaiting a judgement from UEFA on Financial Fair Play.

According to Tuttosport, the solution could be to loan Diawara from Napoli for six months.

The 21-year-old has made just four Serie A starts so far this season, so could well agree to the move if he would get more playing time.

However, Coach Carlo Ancelotti would have to sign off on the move.

Leandro Paredes has told friends from Rome that he wants to return to Serie A, and he would like to wear the Milan jersey. Zenit will at least ask for €30M, and to date, it does not seem that the Russian club will accept any discount for Paredes. [@FabrizioRomano]

Due to the high price, Milan are cautious, but have not yet lost hope on acquiring Paredes, with Gattuso and Leonardo giving their highest approval for the player. Also, a deal will also be very complicated after Milan’s €35M investment in Paquetà. [@FabrizioRomano]

It will be necessary to make a serious effort and then propose an advantageous formula to Zenit to see Paredes join Milan, but to date we have not reached that point. [@FabrizioRomano]

Milan want €15m off Bakayoko
There are reports Milan will only purchase Tiemoue Bakayoko outright from Chelsea for €25m and not the original €40m agreement.

The Rossoneri paid €5m to take him on a one-season loan and have an option to buy in June 2019 for another €35m.

However, Tuttosport suggest his performances have been too poor to warrant such a large spending spree.

Instead, they are demanding a discount of at least €15m on the original price-tag.

Chelsea had wanted €40m in total because that is how much they shelled out to Monaco in the summer of 2017.

So far this term, Bakayoko has been given 12 appearances for Milan between Serie A and the Europa League, but many of them were down to an injury crisis.

Liverpool, Chelsea and Man Utd provide AC Milan January transfer solutions
AC Milan could look to go all in for one player each from three of the Premier League's top sides in Manchester United, Chelsea and Liverpool.

The rossoneri have already signed Lucas Paqueta from Flamengo, with the player set to join up with the squad in January. But they are also looking to make more improvements in their side in the upcoming January transfer window and the Premier League seems like a likely destination for them.

We reported two days ago that Milan had made initial contact to sign Fabinho, with an initial loan deal being proposed. The rossoneri like the player and could do what they did with Chelsea's Tiemoue Bakayoko.

They also see Manchester United's Eric Bailly as a possible target, with the Ivorian now struggling in the Premier League. He has been out of the side since United's 3-2 defeat to Brighton and Hove Albion in the early part of the season.

They could seek refuge in one of Chelsea's players too, with Gary Cahilll having attracted interest from Leonardo's side. They feel he is a short-term fix to their problems at the back. And add depth and brings a lot of experience to the plate.
https://www.calciomercato.com/en/news/liverpool-chelsea-and-man-utd-provide-ac-milan-january-transfer--86059

Exclusive: Leonardo has his eyes on Chelsea's Fabregas as contacts are ongoing
AC Milan have had a huge amount of injuries of late as the rossoneri will likely be active in January to cope with this very delicate situation. Leonardo and Maldini have already begun working on the matter as their goal is to sign at least 2-3 new players come early 2019.

CONTACTS FOR FABREGAS - According to Calciomercato.com sources, it seems like Leonardo has had contacts with Fabregas intermediaries to explore the situation. The Spaniard's contract is soon set to expire as a Chelsea departure seems to be on the cards. Paredes and Lobotka are other options but it seems like Fabregas could be the easier move to pull off at the moment.

THE FORMULA IS BEING DISCUSSED - Milan have interest in Fabregas but they still have to see what formula would be ideal for them and for Chelsea. They will also have to see how they can reduce Fabregas' heavy wages as this remains to be seen. Even so, the rossoneri have their eyes on the Spaniard as a move doesn't seem impossible anymore...

quote.msg:
Exclusive: Leonardo has his eyes on Chelsea's Fabregas as contacts are ongoing
AC Milan have had a huge amount of injuries of late as the rossoneri will likely be active in January to cope with this very delicate situation. Leonardo and Maldini have already begun working on the matter as their goal is to sign at least 2-3 new players come early 2019.

CONTACTS FOR FABREGAS - According to Calciomercato.com sources, it seems like Leonardo has had contacts with Fabregas intermediaries to explore the situation. The Spaniard's contract is soon set to expire as a Chelsea departure seems to be on the cards. Paredes and Lobotka are other options but it seems like Fabregas could be the easier move to pull off at the moment.

THE FORMULA IS BEING DISCUSSED - Milan have interest in Fabregas but they still have to see what formula would be ideal for them and for Chelsea. They will also have to see how they can reduce Fabregas' heavy wages as this remains to be seen. Even so, the rossoneri have their eyes on the Spaniard as a move doesn't seem impossible anymore...

Fabregas must be the priority for AC Milan in January
Leonardo and Maldini are already in the hunt for reinforcements for the January transfer market and the injury crisis at Milanello has led to an emergency situation that requires at least 3 new arrivals to fill the hole made with the injuries of Giacomo Bonaventura, Lucas Biglia and others. Especially the defence and midfield suffers from a shortage of players, which is why Cesc Fabregas should definitely be a player to look at in January.

The lack of creativity in the AC Milan midfield is quite evident, as currently the only competent players available to Gennaro Gattuso are Franck Kessie and Tiémoué Bakayoko, who are viewed more as 'destroyers' rather than creators, which is exactly why Fabregas could be a great addition for the Rossoneri.

Fabregas has collected over 150 assists throughout his career and has the experience from the biggest matches there are for Barcelona, Chelsea and Arsenal, as well as the Spanish national team. He would be an unprecedented addition for a very inexperienced Milan team and would give a big hand to some of the younger players in the team.

Another upside of the deal is obviously the cost of the deal. The 31-year-old's contract at the Stamford Bridge expires at the end of the season, which means he would be available for a small compensation already in the winter transfer window. The salary of the Spaniard could be an obstacle which could, however, be overcome.

The player seems destined to leave Chelsea and could look for a new challenge already in January, seeing as he is only appearing sporadically for Maurizio Sarri's team this season, with just 48 Premier League minutes on his hands, with the rest being in cup competitions.

Landing Fabregas at the San Siro could turn out to be a real bargain for AC Milan. If the experienced midfielder is given an important role in the centre of the field, he might once again show his best capabilities. The slower pace of Serie A could also be an advantage for him and could expose his qualities to the best.

Caldara: ‘Back in February’
Milan defender Mattia Caldara expects to be back around February but “I don’t want to push the time because there’s the risk of relapses”.

The centre-back joined the Rossoneri from Juventus in the summer, but he’s made only one appearance due to a series of injuries.

Initially he was struggling with a muscular problem, and he’s now out until next year with a ruptured achilles tendon.

“It’ll take a few more months,” Caldara confirmed, speaking to Tuttomercatoweb.

“I don’t want to push the time because there’s the risk of relapses.

“Of course, a player just wants to play but I need to think about working well to get back on the pitch as soon as possible and make my contribution.

“February? More or less. We still don’t know the time, but around then.”

Paqueta farewell to Flamengo
Incoming Milan signing Lucas Paquetá says farewell to Flamengo - “this is just a see you later, not a goodbye”.

The 21-year-old will sign for the Rossoneri in January, with his final match to be against Atletico Paranaense next weekend.

“The time has come for the salutes,” Paqueta told Globo Esporte.

“I’m ready to start new adventures, I thank the club for all it has given me, but after 12 years I think the time has come to leave.

“I will have many things on my mind in the next days, I have to rest and work to prepare the last game well.

“I think this is just a see you later, not a goodbye.”

replies.msg:
Milan boss Gennaro Gattuso warns Paqueta“has talent, but needs to do far more” amid reports of Roma interest.

The Brazilian international is only 21years old, but his debut Serie A season has been poor with 1 goal and 1 assist in his first game, then benched for the rest of the season. Gattuso says his performance didn't impressed him much.

“Paqueta has great technique and talent, but right now he needs to improve a great deal,” Gattuso said in a Press conference.

“When you are given the opportunity, you have to make the most of it. He needs to do far more, he has undeniable talent, but players at times need to let themselves be helped. If you don’t train in a certain way because you think that you won’t play, then you have to prove in training why you deserve to play.

“I’ve seen a lot of players improve since I’ve been here. They stay longer in training and work on their specific weaknesses. If you have players who stay there for hours, tugging your shirt and asking to do more, that’s good for the club.

“If we play 4-3-3, then we need certain players with their characteristics. It’s only normal that at the moment we want two wide men with technique and creativity, so only Borini and Bonaventure fit that bill.

“It’s not that I don’t trust in the others, we just have those options for those roles and Suso has completely different characteristics.”

Gattuso Appreciation Post

I really don't understand fans who bitch on Gattuso. His tactics won us a point yesterday (we didn't lose 3 point, we won a point).

People saying he should have made a substitution should really come up with a decent substitution. Castillejo would have offered nothing since we needed physicality and defensive minded players to keep the result. Montolivo, Jose Mauri and Halilovic are just out of the question, if you are calling for them to play than I think you should just stick to another team. Bertolacci is so weak physically and has so little playing time that putting him on as a sub in a high pace, important game like this would make no sense. Laxalt would have made some sense, but Borini was on point defensively last night and there were absolutely no problems on that side of the pitch, so I really don't see a point in that either. Don't forget how we conceded, it was a poor clearance off a desperate long ball. Sometimes the ball bounces against you, and that's just football.

So please stop talking shit and remind yourself how we were losing these games easily before Gattuso and now we are a very solid and compact team, even with shittier players! Remember how all the big teams trampled on us? Well they don't anymore. We went into Olimpico last night with an absolute shit team and played Lazio as equals. This is all Gattuso's mentality and work, and I think he deserves out appreciation.

This is all Gattuso's mentality and work, and I think he deserves out appreciation.

喜歡啜生火雞的艾夫拿的留言激怒了米蘭球迷，大批量米蘭球迷在入其twitter對其進行言語攻擊，艾夫拿也繼續挑舋米蘭球迷，他在instgram的視頻中表示：“為什麼要和我談歷史？過去的人們知道意甲是因為米蘭，但現在人們知道意甲那就要感謝祖雲了，我們不談尊重，我就是想開個玩笑，讓大家笑一笑而已。保羅，你Twitter有很多失敗的米蘭球迷。我愛你!

來吧，我愛你們所有人，也愛這場遊戲，祖雲萬歲！“
梗係唔談歷史啦, 祖記歐聯有乜歷史?拎過幾次歐聯可以比人講? 而家靠佢知道意甲? 等人知道意甲冠軍成日二奶命拎唔到歐聯? 我覺得醜添啊

replies.msg: 艾夫拿都有1個歐聯架, 不過係曼攞

Sarri open to selling Chelsea star to AC Milan on one condition
Chelsea boss Maurizio Sarri could agree to sell Cesc Fabregas in the January transfer window but the Italian tactician wants the Blues to sign a valuable replacement before giving his green light to Fabregas’ move to the San Siro.

The contract of the Spaniard expires in 2019 and the player could be leaving the club as a free agent at the end of the season.

AC Milan, however, are in a hurry to sign midfield reinforcements in the January transfer window.

Lucas Biglia, in fact, will remain out of action for at least three months while the season of Jack Bonaventura is over already with the Italian midfielder that will be forced to undergo a knee surgery and remain on the sidelines for 7-8 months.

Fabregas has been struggling with game time so far this season and AC Milan have already begun talks to sign him in January. Sarri is going to say yes to the transfer but according to Il Corriere dello Sport, he wants a new center midfielder who can replace the former Barcelona star.
https://www.calciomercato.com/en/news/sarri-open-to-selling-chelsea-star-to-ac-milan-on-one-condition-26811

Transfer News: Atletico captain Godin agrees to January move to AC Milan
AC Milan are said to be targeting Diego Godin to reinforce the defence. According to Quotidano Sportiva, the Rossoneri offered the Uruguayan centre-back a contract for two and a half years worth 4 million euros per season. According to the same source, Godin accepted this proposal for a January move and now Leonardo will have to convince the Spanish team to give up their captain already in the winter transfer session, with Godin's contract expiring in June next year.

https://www.calciomercato.com/en/news/transfer-news-atletico-captain-godin-agrees-to-january-move-to-a-41450
